Very pricey for the Quality and Content, the game is Very bare bones in its current state.
By 2H/3H you would've already seen everything.

The game does feel a bit aimless in the beginning, with little to no explanations of things like Taxes, Employees.

Also, With 11 of the 21 screenshots being VERY different to the actual game (In terms of Map Design, and especially Quaility) i recommend watching a Video/Stream of the game before buying, And as im about to point out, the Trailers are misleading too, so just ignore them.

Id also like to point out, in the Gameplay Trailer:
you can see footage of one of the Players cars being stolen, this is not a feature in the game, Cops aren't in the game either.
Buying the shop at the beginning is not something in the game.
Buying cars from the Junkyard is not in the game.

Features:
Buying and Selling cars (Auction, And just cars in a Lot or Neighborhood, You can also take photos of the Cars, but the Camera is fairly Janky, and hard to use)
Basic car tuning (NOS, Turbo, Wheels)
Pretty basic Drifting (1 Special map) and Drag Races (1 VS and 2 Solo maps)
Light Office and House Customization (Office Presets would be a lot nicer due to how time consuming it is)
2 Bar Mini-Games
And of course, a (Seemingly) Paid 'DLC'

Collision:
NPC Humans don't have collision in a Car, NPC Cars don't have collision while on foot, Nearly all environmental Objects besides Walls don't have Collision, and if they do, they're heavily over-sized.

Cars:
Some of the Cheapest cars in the game can outrun some of the most Expensive Cars in the game, Most cars have the Same Sounds as well.

Update Overview:
So far, no major updates have added on to the base Game (i.e. Buying and selling cars)
Everything has either been Drag Races, or drifting tracks, which isn't the reason i, or many others bought the game. But who'd expect a game about buying and selling cars to get updates to add onto buying and selling cars, right?
I mean, Employees were added awhile ago, but all they can do is wash cars and pick up trash, both things that can take the player seconds to do.
And you can only get 1 employee, not that they're useful anyway.
as of 2/26/24, they say they're adding 'tuning', But if it doesn't majorly increase the Value, Why spend the time 'tuning'?

If the Devs aren't going to expand on the Base Game, and only add Filler, then i feel the game shouldn't be marketed as a Salesman Game, because it's really not.
The drifting and racing sections feel more detailed than the base game, even though the Drifting and Racing stuff is more than likely just pre-paid assets.


The game is also Free on Mobile, i'd recommend just getting it there. Exact same features and content. You could even use Dolphin Emulator on PC to play it.

For whats in the game currently, it's just not worth the price, Maybe $5 or $6? but definitely not $18
i'd highly recommend Car Mechanic Simulator 2021 instead, It's at a Similar price, with much more, Higher quality content.

Overall:
It's devs like this that make indie games look bad, And what you see me calling out in the review above, People have been calling out since the game came out, So i highly doubt anything will change.

Also, considering how 90% of the nearly 12K reviews are positive all time, and 538 recent reviews are 88% positive, i HIGHLY expect that the majority of the reviews are fake. Or the devs giving players the game in exchange for a positive review.

If the devs improve the game, maybe i'll come back. Just save your money.

While the game showcases great potential and enjoyable gameplay mechanics, it's evident that it still requires further development to truly shine.

One of the highlights of Car For Sale Simulator 2023 is its engaging premise. The game puts players in the driver's seat of managing a car dealership, from purchasing inventory to negotiating deals with customers. The realistic portrayal of the business aspects adds depth and immersion, making each decision feel impactful.

However, as promising as the game is, there's a noticeable need for more content. While the core gameplay loop is enjoyable, it can feel repetitive after extended play sessions. Adding more variety in terms of car models, dealership customization options, and additional business challenges would greatly enhance the overall experience.

Furthermore, Car For Sale Simulator 2023 is still plagued by some bugs and technical issues. From occasional crashes to minor glitches during gameplay, these issues can disrupt the immersion and hinder the overall enjoyment. It's worth noting, though, that the game is still in early access, and it's reasonable to expect these issues to be addressed in future updates.

In conclusion, Car For Sale Simulator 2023 shows promise as a unique and engaging simulation game. While it currently lacks some depth and polish, its foundation is strong enough to build upon. With continued development and attention to player feedback, there's hope that the developers will iron out the bugs and introduce more content to elevate the game to its full potential.

• Car age should make a significant impact on price
• Car mileage should push the price significant
• Inspecting cheap cars will diminish all gains

[h3]Car fixing:[/h3] 5/25 Points
Nothing you’ll do except repairing will up the sell price.
Hefty sums for installing special equipment, but it doesn’t up the price significantly.

Opinion is mixed. The game is decent, if you ignore the bugs. This game is absolutely riddled with bugs. I've already had 2 auctions where I've lost more than 400,000$ because after the auction, the cars don't spawn in and basically, you get scammed! It's honestly so annoying. Another bug is that it says my office is dirty, when there's literally no trash. I don't really mind it too much, but it is something to note. Another VERY ANNOYING bug is when you're building your office. Holy crap, I have never had a more painful and terrible building experience than this. I can't place objects in certain places where there's literally nothing there, which should allow me to place it there, while I can place a car display pad on top of another pad without issues. I can't place fences around the whole dealer because in the left corner, I just simply can't place it there for no reason! I've removed the concrete, replaced it, and tried placing the fence, multiple times. The last LARGE issue I'll mention is the grid snapping. It is VERY inconsistent. The floor will snap to the grip around 65% of the time. It's really annoying because sometimes, I have to place and delete a piece of concrete multiple times for it to finally snap. All in all, it's a decent game. However, I would wait for the game to go on sale (like it is at the time of posting this), or just wait for the game to be more polished, because right now, I don't think it's worth 14 dollars (what I bought it for at sale price), let alone 18 dollars at full price.  Also, the game could definitely be better optimized. Pushing the bugs aside, the good things about the game are that it has decent graphics, good gameplay, and is pretty fun overall. I just wish it wasn't as buggy.

Title: A Decent Distraction for Car Enthusiasts

Rating: ★★★☆☆ (3/5)

Car For Sale Simulator 2023 offers a simple and somewhat enjoyable experience for those who find solace in the world of car simulations. Picked it up on a whim, and to my surprise, it's proven to be a decent time-passing game in between stressful days.

The game's premise revolves around buying and selling cars, and it's strangely captivating, providing a temporary escape from reality. The mechanics are straightforward, making it accessible for both newbies and simulation enthusiasts. With around 10 hours of gameplay, I managed to explore every nook and cranny of the available content, amassing a comfortable 2 million in-game cash.

However, the downside quickly became apparent - the lack of content depth. I exhausted all possibilities within a relatively short timeframe, leaving me craving for more. While it's understandable that the game is in early access, I hope the developers consider expanding the features and adding more variety to keep players engaged in the long run.

This is my second simulation game, and while my previous experience with Ranch Sim was less than stellar, Car For Sale Simulator 2023 feels more refined. The graphics are acceptable, and the overall gameplay mechanics are solid, providing a smoother experience compared to my previous foray into the simulation genre.

If you're a die-hard car enthusiast, this game might pique your interest, offering a temporary respite from reality. However, if you're looking for a simulation with extensive content and lasting appeal, you might want to hold off until more updates are rolled out. In the end, it's a decent choice for those seeking a quick fix of simulation fun but falls short of becoming a long-term engagement.

This game has a lot of promise but the devs don't seem to care about it as much as they claim they do. 

I bought this game in late august when they actually did deliver what their roadmap promised, while the game is in very early access it was still  fun and enjoyable to play for a few hours. That being said the game is understandably bare bone as of now, the map is small and there isn't much to do. There are plenty of bugs and some features are just annoying to deal with. In particular the auction system which is the only way to get the "featured" cars like gtr, rx7,  etc.

While bugs are fixable, fake marketing is not. The steam page has screenshots of somethings that the game doesn't have, the office seen in the screenshots is different from the one in game, the autoshop too, some cars are missing, the npc cars are different and very low quality compared to the ones you can trade, there are no npcs on the sidewalks, there is no coop or online feature (As of now). I believe marketing something that you don't even have in game doesn't stand up with me. 
While you can add the features later, that's a different side of the story.

Another big No is the fact that the devs claimed in late august that they were trialing their new Office system and needed more time to work on it. Postponing is fine, but if you can't meet the postponed date, at least release some information about the issues, don't leave us in the dark for 2 weeks. 
Lastly, i highly believe that if your game has plenty of bugs, is in such a very early access, you should focus on the game and not start working on your next title. 

As of right not this game feels abandoned. So i do not suggest buying it until further notice from the devs about their plans with the game and some results at the very least.

This game has potential and I want to really like it, since I am really into cars/vehicles. However, there is just too much in terms of bugs and lack of content to do much even with the recent drag race update. What you basically do in this game is run a car dealership, along with customizing the cars you buy and you can also customize the dealership site and your living areas. There are quite a few cars ranging from dodge chargers to BMWs and the like just without brand names/ licenses to approve for using their official names in game. You can sell the cars you buy off for profit and do it all over again or keep some cars for yourself. 

Where the game falls short is the lack of customization for all of these features. There is a limited amount of customization options you can do for the cars and both the dealership/office area and for your living quarters as well. I feel as if there is just limited options and personality to make these how you want them to be.

The controls for this game are awful. I am using an xbox controller and while there is support for it, there is no rumble/force feedback... For a game with cars, you would think while driving around and taking cars from point A to B to get fueled, go racing or crashing there would be some type of feedback... but no this is not to be found whatsoever. If I play a car game, I expect no matter if I am using a wheel or controller to have feedback as I like that type of emersion. The button commands for xbox do show up on screen as guidance but are rather confusing to me as they remain as keyboard buttons rather than switching over to for instance, A,B,X,Y with circles. This did confuse me quite a bit and I mistakenly pressed the keyboard buttons on some inputs thinking the keyboard mode was still enabled. There is also a lack of a "look around" camera inside and outside the car specifically for the xbox/controllers that are not an actual mouse and there is no way from my knowledge that this can be fine tuned in settings to have it set to the left or right sticks. But this camera mode works fine on foot and walking with the xbox control stick normally as you would expect. There is also no way to adjust the cars sensitivity to your liking as well. You are stuck with however the cars handle by default.

I also know that there is a alcohol/gambling "mini game" I guess you would call it. Not sure what that has to do with running a car dealership. If you try buying alcohol and drinking a few beers and go out and drive a car, it just acts as if you didn't drink anything at all, there is no emersion to that, unless your at the bar playing blackjack or walking around on foot. The drag race is a good feature though beyond that as a mini game as well as the other open areas you can go via the tow truck down the road from your dealership premises. 



Then on to the bugs in game, its just quite horrible and messy as of the drag race update. With the AI, Either there are some ai, or not enough on the map and roads. The ai in places randomly gets stuck or just randomly piles on top of each other or they just go real slow most of the time. No ai appears driving during the night as of the recent update in my experience. Then, when you take the cars in for repair at the repair shop and it goes up on the automated lift, the arms clip into the doors of most cars... There is also a ton of pop-in for the background scenery both at the day and night cycles, that is very annoying. I have everything on ultra settings but it looks everyday in game especially during the day it is either foggy or the horizon is too bright...

The photo mode also needs a little bit of fine tuning as I would like to see options to hide the UI and to be able to take custom photos and upload them directly to steam. Also, the day and night cycles are too fast and seemingly last only 10-15 mins to barely do anything. There should be an option to slow down or speed up the time in 1x-100x like in farming simulator for your preference.

Overall, there needs to be improvements on the controls, customization options and the bugs I mentioned. Hopefully these can be sorted out in the next update with the UI overhall and the office customization update that the devs announced already. For now in this games current state, I just cannot recommend.

+ So far the best simulator of this work 
+ many ways you can come to new cars such as auctions  hall and car market... 
+Many tuning options for almost every car.  We are talking here about tuning appearance (color of lights, neon...) and not performance and stability.  
+In addition to selling cars, you can also do other activities, such as playing black jack and either going bankrupt or getting rich quickly, and it didn't work for me yet, but it was also possible to load the car on a truck and drive somewhere outside the city where you could test drive your car.

- it's more of a short game. The second you get to super sports and hyper sports, you are simply rich and the game immediately loses any greater meaning. It's not right away, but somehow it doesn't take long if you know how to do it
- the system that determines the price of the car and everything around it in general is still quite bad.  As for me, I tried to enjoy the game to the fullest and honestly take photos of everything as it should and make descriptions, etc... What is really supposed to raise the price of the car, so I quickly found out that all you have to do is put a car in the game without a photo and without a description or maybe completely out of the picture  description and even then the car will be sold and perhaps even for a good price.  And a car that is honestly photographed and described will be sold anyway.  There is no difference yet.  
- I consider the tablet to be one of the rather important things in this game.  Thanks to him, everything is done on the spot and, above all, the car can be photographed.  But it is not said exactly where the tablet is.  The player is not exactly directed to the bar to buy it there.

I would rate the game 5.5/10 right now. The potential behind this game is great, however right now the execution is not really great. 

Main issue I have with this game is the price tag. The price of 17.5 euro is quite high considering that this is seriously unfinished product right now. Game is filled with bugs. Only few minutes in game I experienced at least 10 bugs that are not forgiving for the price devs ask for.

Some of the notorious bugs that require quick fixing are:
- Report bug dialog is not allowing you to write paragraph (quite ironic)
- NPC people are walking through objects, spawning and disappearing abruptly, walking and standing/sitting awkwardly like we are in year 2008
- Day to night transition is laughably abrupt (again, like we are in 90s now)
- Car sometimes won't accelerate until you re-enter the car
- Car camera always resets to first person
- Car camera switch is not always consistent (sometimes the camera angle order is not correct)
- English is broken in user interface (wrong/bad translation etc.)
- NPC cars are spawning in laughable rate (on one part the streets are completely empty like we are in pandemic curfew, than we will have 4 cars driving at the distance of 1 meter between each other)
- No collision detection between car and person
- Tablet/phone camera is zooming in for no reason
- Can't look behind the car when in first person camera angle

These are some urgent issues that dev team should fix. There are plenty of minor bugs I can get over for now.

Another thing that is not quite right are some of the game mechanics. For example, tuning/panting/fixing cars is not profitable. You can literally go and buy a car, put it on sale with random title and no pictures, and make profit. It breaks the game when you can literally do nothing and earn money. Also, adding pictures/title etc. when you put car on sale makes no impact on sale.

Cars also feels pretty much the same. 

I would not recommend this game right now. If the price was 10 or less euros yes, but for this price the game is just not worth it. Maybe if the team fix some of the mentioned issues things would change.

For those of you who have seen my reviews, I typically wait until I've had a good amount of time played before making a review; this is a change of form. I didn't play this game for long because, admittedly, I was rather disappointed.
+Pros:
+The game is exactly as advertised; you go to a car show or neighborhood and try to swindle customers for cars. There's a lot of diversity in the cars you can find while out hunting.
+Car customization: being able to change the color and sheen of the car is a nice touch.
+It's a relatively simple game with the loop of: buy car, fix it/customize it, sell it, sleep, repeat. Time progresses independently so there is a day night cycle.
-Cons:
-Unfinished*: The game is largely unfinished; human sprites are wonky, some of the interfaces don't work correctly, the driving can be described as buggy and overly sensitive. *Now, I understand that this is early access, so hopefully some of these things will be fixed in the full release.*
-Expectations aren't met: I came to this game after watching Markiplier play Gas Station Simulator and I wanted something more in depth. Now, these are not at all the same game, but this is definitely more of a dealership simulator (like I wanted), but for the price I paid for it, it didn't do it for me; I wasn't immersed in the game.
-Price: So, I bought this game when it was on sale for $10.79, but the normal retail is around 20 bucks usd! This game feels, to me, that it's still in its playtesting phase; that this should be a release to playtesters to work out bugs and improve the experience, but, instead, it is up to the public to purchase this game and find out for themselves.
*Conclusion*
*This game is exactly as advertised, with a simple game loop that may keep some entertained, but that did not do it for me. Developers, I encourage you to continue working on this project, it seems like a labor of love and will do well with some TLC. It's just, for me, this game isn't worth the money (as of the games current release).

Great Concept, Lackluster Execution - A Disappointing Experience
Rating: ★★☆☆☆

As someone who typically supports indie developers and values gameplay over graphics, I was genuinely excited to try this out. The game presented a unique concept within its genre, but sadly, the overall implementation left much to be desired. It felt as though the development was outsourced to a budget developer from a freelance platform.

The most glaring issue that struck me was the lack of soul and artistic touch in the game. It seemed to be missing that special something that could have made it truly immersive and engaging. Moreover, there were noticeable size inconsistencies with various objects in the game, such as the doors and couches, which were disproportionately larger than they should have been in relation to the player's size. These inconsistencies created a jarring and unrealistic experience.

Given that the game was developed using Unity, it was disheartening to see the missed opportunity to significantly enhance the graphics. It would have taken only a few hours of research on YouTube tutorials to learn how to improve the visuals and, at the very least, apply lightmaps to enhance the overall lighting quality. The fact that prominent YouTubers had already voiced their concerns about the dark car photos, and this issue persisted even in the trailer, indicates a lack of attention to detail and responsiveness to player feedback.

While it had a promising concept, the disappointing execution and lackluster attention to visual details ultimately overshadowed its potential. I truly hope the developer takes note of the feedback and considers making the necessary improvements to provide a more enjoyable and visually appealing experience for players. 

As it stands, I find it challenging to recommend this game, even for those who are usually supportive of indie titles, but I will keep a close look on how it develops and probably will change my review.

Not in a state to play. Too many bugs. The driving is bad. Bargaining doesn't work. They will give you a price and if you try to bargain they just say no and give you the same price again. Which is lower than the cost of the purchase. There is no game balance here. Dev needs a lot of work to be done before this can be considered playable.

I say yes i recommend, but ONLY because there isn't a really good competitor and this has promise.
Note I have a lot of negative things to say, BUT it is early access and there is a good chance that in a year none of this will be relevant.

1. In terms of "caring" for the car. Any mechanic game (Car Mechanic 21 for example) does it better. Heck even the customization in NFS games is better/more fun. But this will likely be expanded on in the future??
2. The management of "stock" is a boring loop atm. Go to neighborhood->Pray to RNGsus for a car you can buy->check the car show if it's even around->sell your car for minimal profit 9 times outta 10 (or wait for an hour to get tht one customer willing to pay the price for the car)->rinse and repeat. 
Hopefully they'll add better ways for procuring cars, not really a dealership if the only way i get a car is one at a time from my neighbors who somehow always need to sell cars.
3. Customization of the business isn't bad, but very limited and incredibly simplistic in appearance. I fully expect that to change as things progress.
4. The controls are absolutely garbage. I don't like driving with keyboard and mouse, but controllers are barely usable with how the bindings end up and they're completely unchangeable. Sensitivity is insane, I had to lower it by a lot to even be able to use my mouse and then it messed with the controller so i had to change it some again. The driving is incredibly basic and the handling between cars is wildly different. Ridiculously so, some cars will drift at the slightest input and others corner like a container ship (even tho it's a hatchback).
5. As with all Early Access games, the world is VERY empty and there is very little to actually do. Granted the concept (buying/selling cars) is pretty simple but the world itself is just empty and what is in the world is very simple (both in appearance and mechanics/interactions)

Controls are probably my biggest complaint. Everything else is Early Access quality issues and things one expects will be worked on. But the controls are absolutely unusable for me and I'd almost not recommend on that fact alone. But I really like the concept they have here and it'll be interesting what they can do with it. It's also cheap(-ish) in terms of games on Steam so worth checking out.

EDIT: Forgot to mention, updates are coming out at a really  good pace and that is the main reason I recommend despite my issues with the game. Frequent updates and announcements regarding roadmaps/etc are always a good sign to me and will always earn a thumbs up for the dev(s) (assuming they keep it coming)

I recently came across some gameplay videos of Cars for Sale on YouTube, and I must say, I was genuinely excited about the potential of the game. However, as I delved deeper into the gameplay, I couldn't help but feel a sense of disappointment due to some missing features that I had seen showcased.

Firstly, the ability to watch the car by Sponge seemed like a fantastic addition. It's a unique concept that could have added an extra layer of immersion to the game. I was really looking forward to experiencing that feature and utilizing it to understand the condition of the cars in a more interactive way.

Additionally, the absence of the junkyard as a gameplay element left me somewhat perplexed. I had seen glimpses of it in the promotional materials, and I envisioned it as a place where I could search for hidden treasures, repair and restore old vehicles, or perhaps even salvage parts to enhance the cars I sell. Its exclusion feels like a missed opportunity to diversify the gameplay experience.

Lastly, the missing features related to office decoration left me wanting more. It's always enjoyable to have the freedom to personalize and beautify one's surroundings, and I had hoped to see that reflected in the game. Whether it's choosing different furniture, wallpapers, or even trophies to display, the option to customize the office space would have added a delightful touch.

I understand that game development is a complex process, and sometimes certain features may not make it into the final product due to various reasons. However, as a passionate player, I wanted to express my disappointment at the absence of these features, which I believe could have significantly enriched the overall gameplay experience.

I sincerely hope that the Cars for Sale team considers implementing these missing features in future updates or expansions. With the addition of these elements, the game would truly become a standout experience and capture the hearts of even more players.

Anyway, Thank you for your attention and for creating Cars for Sale.

I feel this is a good game with a lot of potential
The pros include
-Interactive web page interface where you can upload photos of the cars and list them for sale
-Skill based progression based on cars sold and cars cleaned by hand. The more you play the more you unlock
-Variety of different cars with different car models.
-Different methods of purchasing vehicles including auctions, approaching people in neighbourhoods and car shows.
The cons
-Some of the car models interiors are very low quality however i suspect this will improve in time
-Some of the cars don't allow you to fully clean them by hand such as the Bmw 1m rep audi tt rep and audi r8 rep
-General performance issues with the game when skipping a night by sleeping in the bed for a minute.

Overall i would consider this to be a fun game however £15 is quite steep for the game in the current condition and also is just lacking the content for the price. I've completed the game to the point i can own anything i want after about 10 hours and after 14 hours it has just got a bit repetitive with nothing new to note. Overall i would purchase it but wait for a sale.

Played about 11 hours and i think I've seen pretty much all there is to see. This is a pretty awesome car dealer sim. You run your own dealership - buy cars, fix them up (if you want to) and sell them for a profit. It is pretty eurojank - plenty of dodgy english translations, character models and animations are jank;  nothing really game breaking though and the game itself is pretty unique in both it's concept and execution. 

There's huge potential from the base that's currently in game. The driving is surprisingly good for a game that has no racing, wandering around the town finding cars to buy, then listing them and selling them is a fun game loop. There are also minor side activities that are kind of meaningless but hint at future potential and game mechanics that may be expanded on.. 

The devs are pretty active and there's been pretty regular updates. This game is in ealy access and things break - you may note all the thumbs downs because of broken save games - but that's the nature of early access. If you don't want to deal with that however it may be worth holding off until the game gets closer to full release.

 I'd say this game is worth getting - the 11 hours I've played have been fun and worth the entry price. I'm probably not going to play much more until there's more updates and things to do - but even if the development died now, I'd consider the price of the game well worth the the time I've played.

Unfortunately I have to leave this game as a "wait and see." I will update the review as the game progresses. 

TLDR: Intriguing game premise with an empty map, and too many current bugs/translation issues. If the game sees refinement in future updates, then it could possibly be quite a fun little game.

The premise of the game is intriguing. You buy used cars in hopes of selling them for profit after fixing them up (paint, mechanical/electrical, and washing.) You can buy these used cars either by walking around the (very small) neighborhood in the game, or by attending the weekly "car market." You'll save the game by sleeping in your bed at your home, which begins--in true simulator fashion--as a container with boarded up windows and a dirty bed. All of this is contained in an open world that you can navigate by either driving your cars or taking the bus to different stops placed around the map. 

Unfortunately, the game map in its current state feels barren. There are vast stretches of flat, empty space on the map, and there is a lot of optimizing needed in the areas of the map that do have objects/NPCs in them. Certain cars have a tendency to flip at random or glitch out. There are large amounts of the game that appear to be still in the works, such as the tablet which shows up on your TAB menu, but cannot be used. The English version has a multitude of grammatical/spelling errors, and in general, the game just feels like a super early draft. 

However, the game shows a lot of promise--especially considering that the main gameplay loop seems to fit a niche in the simulation genre. I would be surprised if someone could keep themselves entertained with this game beyond 10 hours in its current state. However, I am hopeful that this is just the beginning for Car For Sale Simulator 2023--what a unique concept for a game!

Here's the rundown.....

Positives
-----------
-- Great concept that many of us want in other games and never get.
-- Trading AI isn't bad ... about a 6/10. It works.
-- Added content like the mechanics , junkyard and bar are a nice touch. Makes you want more.
-- Ranking system telling you how you ranked compared to other players. (was removed after a few hours though)

Negatives
-----------
-- Bugs bugs bugs. Developers are reacting fairly fast. Day 1 had a black screen sleep bug that is already fixed.
-- I HATE BAD GAMBLING CONCEPTS! The Bar has blackjack which can be used to ruin the games money system. 
-- Legs seem to be a problem in this game. Creepy to watch.
-- Map isn't that big. Not much content or hidden content. 
-- Late game not much to do. You sell cars faster then your lot can hold. 
-- Driving in this game can be fun but you can skip driving anywhere which takes out the risk. Like blackjack in the bar not having to drive saves you time and money.

Overall it took me 5 hours to build everything and find myself not challenged. But again it's still a YES because I was really impressed with how quickly the developer fixed some of the bugs on release. I've played many EA games and rarely do the developers react that fast. Here's hoping they keep pushing this game into a success.
